page.title: 01GENERAL VIEW.
page.content: Our survey covers part of the North Notts. area known as Bassetlaw. Most of the survey area is agricultural land. The soils are light and sandy, being part of what was Sherwood Forest. The farming carried out is mainly arable with wheat, barley, sugarbeet, potatoes and peas being the main crops. Some dairy cattle are also kept to provide milk in some areas. The A1/M is a major feature of our survey area. It is one of the main north/south routes in the country linking London and the South/East to Scotland. Blyth with a population of 1300 approximately is the only village in the survey area. Blyth is a sleepy dormitory for the surrounding industrial towns of Sheffield, Doncaster, Rotherham, Worksop, Nottingham and Retford.
